School_A remains one of my top choices, and if offered admission I will accept immediately and enroll.

Thank you again for your consideration.

Sincerely,
Student_C
conversation.thought: Only School_A remains unmatched, and it is my 2nd true choice. School_A explicitly invited me to submit a formal application in round 26 for late-stage reassessment, so I should apply now and clearly commit if accepted.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_C,

Thank you for your formal late-stage application and for your patience throughout the process.

At this point in the cycle, we are prepared to extend you an offer for our remaining seat. If you are still able to commit as stated, we are pleased to welcome you to School_A.

Sincerely,
School_A Admissions

[ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: We are School_A with quota 1 and true priority list B > D > A > E > C. Only Student_C is applying this round. Student_C is last on our list, but still acceptable; leaving seat empty is worse than matching with an included student, especially at late stage (round 26) with no evidence higher-priority students will apply. Student_C has repeatedly reaffirmed commitment to enroll immediately. Accepting now secures a match and avoids ending unmatched if higher-priority students never appear.
